intro: Hubera sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambira hubera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with a fragrant aroma. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
